SDXC/SDHC support on C2

  • Quote

Unread post by tom81 » Sat Jun 25, 2016 5:22 pm

Hello,
simple question: Does the C2 support SDXC cards? I have a 64G Samsung Evo+ card which is not recognized at all by the C2.

Thanks
tom81

Re: SDXC support on C2

  • Quote

Unread post by odroid » Sat Jun 25, 2016 6:19 pm

We tested 64GB and 128GB micro-SD cards and it worked. So most SDXC cards should be compatible with C2.

Re: SDXC/SDHC support on C2

  • Quote

Unread post by LazyBunny » Sat Jul 16, 2016 9:38 pm

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.a ... 6820301309
Silicon Power Elite 32GB SDHC is working great, Fast, snappy, doesn't get warm at all. Can write large files without any additional heat.
Silicon Power Elite 64GB, SDXC, is not working so well. It works, but it gets very warm. The system is getting constant stutters.

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.a ... 6820231838
G.SKILL 32GB microSDHC Flash Card Model FF-TSDHC32GA-U3
Worked fine at first, but then it had the same problems as the 64gb Silicon power card. It would get very warm, even hot to the touch. And would have constant stutters on the system.

My experience with those 2 non-working cards may just be on my end. possibly a voltage problem.
These are all using Android btw.
Apply bunny directly to face.
*Facebun*

This is the first microSD card has a compatibility issue with C2.

odroid wrote:User "tmemkle" reported SanDisk 64GB Extreme Plus SDSQXWG-064G doesn't work on C2 while his Sandisk 32GB Ultra worked well.
This is the first microSD card has a compatibility issue with C2.
Hmmm... I own a very similar model, but as 32GB version.

SanDisk Extreme 32GB UHS-I U3/Class 10, SDSQXNE-032G-GN6AA
71rQWrcU4xL._SL1500_.jpg
(19.41 KiB) Downloaded 1557 times
And it works flawlessly.

Perhaps tmemkle does have problems with the card reader / formatting? Perhaps not every card reader can handle such a UHS-I U3 card.

Re: SDXC/SDHC support on C2

  • Quote

Unread post by fletch » Wed Jan 04, 2017 12:50 am

I seem to be having a problem with this card: SanDisk Extreme 32GB microSDHC UHS-I Card with Adapter (SDSQXVF-032G-GN6MA)

http://a.co/6CAhGco

I've tried both Android and Ubuntu images from the Odroid site, and things fail after a few reboots every time. I'm going to use another 32 GB Sandisk Ultra to be sure I don't have a hardware problem, but from what I've been reading on this forum, it's probably the card with a new standard.

I guess I'll save it for the camera. It's a good thing these cards are pretty cheap now!

Unread post by joy » Tue Mar 28, 2017 4:29 pm

We found one of SanDisk 32GB Ultra microSDHC UHS-I card has a problem during system reboot.

Model ID : SDSDQUA-032G-UQ46A
card_1.jpg
(20.12 KiB) Downloaded 333 times

Code: Select all

odroid@odroid64:~$ sudo reboot
[sudo] password for odroid: 
[   30.888208] watchdog watchdog0: watchdog did not stop!
[   31.965009] reboot: Restarting system
INFO:    PSCI Affinity Map:
INFO:      AffInst: Level 0, MPID 0x0, State ON
INFO:      AffInst: Level 0, MPID 0x1, State ON
INFO:      AffInst: Level 0, MPID 0x2, State ON
INFO:      AffInst: Level 0, MPID 0x3, State ON
bl31 reb�GXBB:BL1:08dafd:0a8993;FEAT:EDFC318C;POC:3;RCY:0;EMMC:800;NAND:81;SD:800;USB:8;

(Not detect SD card, keep searching it)
Please note that there is a difference with other Model of the same product even though features are same.
For example,
we have another model, "SDSQUNC-032G-GN6MA"
and there is no problem related to " system reboot".
